transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Educational and Cultural Exchange Programs,
Department of State, Educational and Cultural Exchange Programs,

title.narrative: Preservation of Niani Ethnographic Objects at the National Museum of Guinea

description.narrative: To support the preservation of the collection of ethnographic objects of Niani, the capital of the Muslim Mandingo empire from the 13th to the 15th century, in the National Museum of Guinea in Conakry. The 4,000 objects in the collection lack an appropriate storage environment, and the exhibition space is in a poor state due to water, insect, and environmental damage. This project involves the cleaning and consolidation of artifacts and repairs to the building and exhibition spaces.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Assisting the Government of Guinea

description.narrative: Under this project, International Organization for Migration (IOM) will partner with two local NGOs to support the government of Guineas efforts to combat trafficking in persons by reinforcing the capacities of the government body responsible for preventing human trafficking, protecting victims, and prosecuting perpetrators. IOM will provide training to police, border officials, labor inspectors, prosecutors, and magistrates, with a focus on the legislative framework as stipulated in the 2016 Guinean penal code. IOM will create a coordination mechanism among government, civil society, and private sector actors to support and strengthen awareness against false job offers and prevent young migrants from falling into trafficking networks. IOM will help develop, and train officials to implement, guidelines for NGOs and government counterparts on victim identification and provision of protection services. IOMs NGO partners will raise awareness on TIP in seven regions of the country and will administer reintegration grants for victims of trafficking.
